# actualDeliveryDate

**Instance Property**

The date this notification was actually delivered.

## Declaration

```swift
var actualDeliveryDate: Date? { get }
```

## Discussion

The notification center will set this value if a notification is put in the scheduled list and the delivery time arrives.

If the notification is delivered directly using the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserNotificationCenter/deliver(_:)] method of the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserNotificationCenter] class, this value is set to the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserNotification/deliveryDate] value. If the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserNotification/deliveryDate] value `nil`  this value is set to the current date.

This value is used to sort the list of notifications in the user interface.

## Delivery Timing

- **deliveryDate**: Specifies when the notification should be delivered.
- **deliveryRepeatInterval**: Specifies the date components that control how often a user notification is repeated.
- **deliveryTimeZone**: Specify the time zone to interpret the delivery date in.
